subject: Re: [junit] trouble with installation
msgSnippet: JUnit does not require any changes to the PATH. If you use Ant, just dump junit.jar into Ant s lib directory, then it ll be available to all Ant builds. If you
messageBody:
JUnit does not require any changes to the PATH. If you use Ant, just
dump junit.jar into Ant's lib directory, then it'll be available to
all Ant builds. If you don't use Ant (shame on you) then you could add
an entry to the CLASSPATH environment and point at the junit.jar that
way.

Hope this helps.


On Sun, 27 Mar 2005 01:50:04 -0000, bill_leang <bill_leang@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
> I'm new to JUnit, and having trouble installing. Although i've
> unzipped the file to a folder in C:, and use "set CLASSPATH = C:\.."
> (and even go to Control Panel|System|Advanced tab|Environment Variable
> to edit the PATH variable to include the path to the folder, I still
> couldn't run the installation test. The error was "Exception in the
> thread "main" Java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:> junit/textui/TestRunner"
> It seems like the computer couldn't find the test files. Please Help :)
> Sincerely,
> Bob
